confession.seduction_context: While looking for lost animals, approached by man in black with goat who offered to make her rich and tell her where animals were. Resisted initially but yielded on third visit.

devil_mark.description: Executioner pushed pin right in without her feeling any pain

accused.name: Dieudonnée femme Mengeon Henry le Jeune

confession.devil_appearance: man in black on black horse
confession.seduction_context: Had been angry about bad bargains husband made over horses, and a man in black on black horse appeared to her. Persuaded her to renounce God and have intercourse with him.
sabbat_activities: wine and roast meat, with goblets and plates of pewter

prior_accusations.context: Claudatte's sister, burned as witch some 10 years earlier
Died in prison when accused of witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée (in threat to Blaise Fresse)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il se taise, et qu'elle en auroit bien sa raison sans beaucoup courir
notable_quotes.context: After son was fined by Blaise Fresse

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte (to husband)
notable_quotes.french: Mon bel Mongeon, je n'en scaurois que faire, sy tu m'y mene j'ay y mener jusques a cinq ou six
notable_quotes.context: When husband threatened to take her to St Dié to be tried

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée
notable_quotes.french: Je t'ay desia cousté je te cousteray encor
notable_quotes.context: To Lyenard Jean Mareschal after he called her witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Jacob Willemin (to Dieudonnée's husband)
notable_quotes.french: foutteur de genaxe, je tay vendue une maison et tu ne la veulx pas prendre, mais tu la prendras et tiendras ton marché, l'on m'a rapporté que ta femme avoit dit que cy tost que tu serois dedans je ne demeureray guerre a la mienne, nous verrons ce qui en sera

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte
notable_quotes.french: je suis bien malheureuse en ce monde
notable_quotes.context: When Laurent Bormes thought he saw her fall from sky

notable_quotes.speaker: wife of Jean Jacques Claude
notable_quotes.french: Genaxe tu as esté jeune putain tu seras viellle genaxe

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte (to Claudotte femme Hannezo Gadel)
notable_quotes.french: Genaxe tu as mangé mon coeur et m'as donné ce mal, tu me l'osteras

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée
notable_quotes.french: qu'il falloit qu'elle face quelquefois ung maulvais coup parce que l'on l'appelloit sorciere
notable_quotes.context: General statement about being called witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée
notable_quotes.french: Voila l'argent aultant vault que je le jecté a la riviere

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée (in dispute)
notable_quotes.context: Opened window and shouted when husband would not help her

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonné Claude Henry (to Claudatte)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il n'avoit affaire d'elle sy elle ne vouloit donner la santé a sa femme qu'estoit malade, et qu'elle allast hors de sa maison que c'estoit une sorciere
notable_quotes.context: Confronting Claudatte about his wife's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Jean Bon Temps (to Claudatte)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle advisast de luy donner sa santé, et qu'elle avoit ja faict des choses en la maison dudit Dieudonné, que le tout viendroit ensemble

Dieudonnée sold bread
Laurent Bormes gave Claudatte plate of beans
Claudatte used to make estuve for leg

Devil tried to make Claudatte burn her chapelet; Dieudonnée used chapelet in prison
Diabolical powder for malefices
Given something like ashes by devil
Money given by devil that was piece of glass
Annon was selling wine, refused Claudatte a glass
Servant refused Claudatte some lard
Claudatte brought to dying woman
Claudatte gave to cure illness; Catherine refused to give to Claudatte
Claudatte gave apples to cure illness
Dieudonnée gave cake to cure Mengeon Didier Girard
At sabbat
At sabbat
Used by those with leg injuries

hearsay_chains.content: Didielle told witness that after Dieudonnée threatened them she had lost her husband
Didielle said Dieudonnée had killed her first husband Jacob Willemin

hearsay_chains.reporter: Jehennon veuve Oswald Treschey le jeune
hearsay_chains.content: Heard wife of Leonard Walther call Dieudonnée witch during a quarrel
Father-in-law told him that when quarrelling with his son Dieudonnée told him if she was pregnant the child was not his but the devil's
Had heard story about Claudatte always making 3 turns round tree on way to church
Father-in-law said they should curse the hour when someone cut the rope with which Dieudonnée was hanging herself

emotional_state_notes: Claudatte begged to be released, offered to leave goods for costs
Dieudonnée said she would put her knife into stomach of anyone who called her witch in future
Dieudonnée noted to look in good health with no marks on body after retracting confession

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over payments, house purchases, and animal sales. Claudatte lived by begging after becoming widow. Several quarrels over food items refused (salt, wine, lard, soup). Dieudonnée sold bread and had disputes over payment.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial of two accused women, both related to the Henry family. Rich detail on witness testimony, healing practices by Claudatte, extensive confession details under torture. Dieudonnée retracted confession once but renewed it under second torture session. Both sentenced to death with Change de Nancy approval.
